misc: Known for deliberating his next shot for a long time, leading to somewhat slow play
biography: Panu, a familiar face at the Hector Trophée, is known for his strategic approach to the game. While his home club remains a mystery, his presence on the course is always notable.

Across 3 appearances at the Hector Trophée, Panu has secured one victory, demonstrating his capability to perform under pressure. Although he has yet to clinch the Victor Trophy for individual excellence, his focus on team success is well-regarded.

Those who have had the pleasure of watching Panu in action know that he is known for his meticulous planning, often deliberating at length before each shot. This can sometimes lead to a slower pace of play, but it reflects his commitment to precision.

Currently considered retired from Hector Trophée events, Panu will not be participating in the upcoming 2025 tournament. However, as we know, the world of golf can be unpredictable, and last-minute changes are always a possibility.
